name: Novotel Convention & Wellness Roissy CDG

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I check into a Novotel hotel, I expect a certain standard. In most ways, this hotel meets that standard; as other reviewers have commented, it is clean, spacious and affordable. The lobby area is fine. Service is always prompt and efficient. The bed is good, the soundproofing fully effective and the breakfast buffet is of a good standard.
reviews.title: Unfortunate first impression

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, when I first come to my room tired after a long day’s travelling, I want to relax and make a cup of tea. Unfortunately, this gave rise to a poor first impression. Two disposable paper cups if you want to make a cup of tea, and little wooden sticks to stir with, rather than cups and a teaspoon - more reminiscent of Formule 1 than Novotel. A minor detail that would take little to remedy, but giving the impression of cheapskating. (I simply don't accept an argument that this is in some way to protect the environment.) The 2 UHT milk sachets provided would be insufficient for a single cup of tea for those who take it that way. A very limited dinner menu more like a snack bar, which included tired reheated french fries.
reviews.title: Pool was closed and staff were unfriendly.

reviews.text: Overnighting before a flight is never something that one relishes. However, it is a pity that small things detracted from what would otherwise be a quite good experience.
reviews.title: Great price, lovely hotel; a keeper!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Novotel for just one night and I'm glad it was just one.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel close to the Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed as we had a number of hours to burn. Since there is nothing to do in Roissy we figured we would use the pool.
reviews.title: nice place around CDG

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This review may be well overdue but as I always keep up with past hotels on TA could not believe some of the not so flattering reviews. It is well over 2 years since we stayed there both prior to and after a 4 week tour of Russia and South of France but both visits were
reviews.title: Better late than never!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: extremely comfortable and we definitely had no complaints with either staff, room service,
reviews.title: Convenient location for Villepinte Exhibition Center, but they need to improve service to meet 4*

reviews.text: size of room or the unhelpfulness of the shuttle driver. Having read earlier reviews knew
reviews.title: Very comfortable stay but room service not meeting a 4*

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: exactly where to wait for shuttle after exiting customs and what was expected by us to use this shuttle. Putting our own luggage onto shuttle and retrieving them at your destination is no big deal and really not worthy of a complaint. On arrival at the hotel which I believe was preceded by a very pleasant drive from airport, there are trolleys available for your convenience to load, albeit, yourself and then can be taken up to your room and returned at a later time to reception. Once again, really no drama. We ourselves arrived very early in the morning and of course our room was not available, I tried, but rules are rules. This is probably my only concern about it being an airport hotel that early arrivals can not be accommodated without the purchase of an early checkin rate. We declined the offer has our deal via their website was less than the early checkin cost so just chose to reorganize ourselves, use their toilet facilities and head back on the shuttle to the airport and subsequent train into Paris where we spent the most fabulous day just walking everywhere, which believe me after a very long flight ex Melbourne was rather daunting at the beginning. On our return decided upon room service which arrived promptly, well presented and hot. Finally bed and slept very well, bed really comfortable but I probably would have slept just as well on the floor as I was so tired. Bathroom spotless with all necessary amenities and breakfast the following morning, a delight with so many options. On our return a month later, everything was as perfect as our first visit, once again no complaints and would not hesitate to return to this hotel on our next visit to Paris. Total convenience even though not right at airport, to me a bonus as less noise, shuttle was easy and prompt, service efficient and friendly and rooms very, very comfortable. A great alternative to an airline seat or airport departure lounge for 30 odd hours!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Ignore the bad reviews...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is quite close to the airport, so it is quite a good location especially for the Exhibition Center in Villepinte; you get the advantage of quick transfer.
reviews.title: Way over-rated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on our last night in France as we had an early flight. It was seamless to check in, drop off our luggage and return our rental car to the airport. I was able to print off our boarding passes on the computer station off of the lobby. The entrance is very large and modern. We had a typical Novotel superior room, Bright with a comfortable bed, sofa and well equiped bathroom.
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel with good service!

reviews.text: Roissy appears to have a pleasant little town with several restaurants but we ordered room service and the food was excellent and the service great.
reviews.title: Nice hotel near the airport

reviews.text: The only negatives were our wait at the airport for the hotel shuttle after we dropped off our car. We waited over 30 minutes and noiced that the other hotels in the area had several buses go by during that time. The return shuttle to the airport leaves you at a terminal and you have to take an airport bus to your departure terminal so we took a taxi in the morning from the hotel right to the Air Canada departure area for 20 euros.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but expensive for the services

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all I would definitely stay here again. They really could upgrade the towels!!! Pretty low end and skimpy!!! Must be a Novotel thing as the towels in our Metz hotel were almost threadbare.
reviews.title: Fantastic Staff

reviews.text: We spent our last day in Paris at this Novotel due to our early flight home. It was our second stay at this hotel in 2 years. We had a triple executive room booked, but were given keys to a standard room. I promptly notified the receptionist and we were upgraded to a triple executive suite and given a free drink at the bar for our party.
reviews.title: Problem sorted - happy customer!
Very nice hotel
reviews.text: We liked the free shuttle to and from the CDG as well as the free Wifi. Unfortunately, the gym was closed for refurbishing, but the kids enjoyed the pool, steam room and PS3. Also had a reasonable dinner at the hotel. My sea scallops were sweet and cooked perfectly, but the vegetables that accompanied this dish were average. The comprehensive buffet breakfast available from 5.30am helped with our early start to the CDG.
Yes, we would return to this hotel in future.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel for last nigth
Very Good Hotel
reviews.text: We spent a late afternoon and evening in the hotel which we had chosen because of the training/gym facilities. Our travel plan did not allow us to go into Paris so this was an excellent opportunity to spend the time in a rather remote areas as CDG. The facilities definitely lived up to our expectations with a well equipped fittness room, a small pool, hammam and sauna. The staff were very serviceminded.

reviews.title: OK hotel
reviews.text: The restaurant was very dissappointing. The well-done steak was very red and the side dish vegetables were low quality frozen stuff that tasted of "air"....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Novotel has everything one needs for an overnight stay at CDG. Good sized rooms, no aircraft noise, comfortable beds, and wi-fi. The staff are helpful and attentive. Plenty of secure parking, for a fee. The breakfast offering is very good but not cheap at Euros 19 per person.
reviews.title: Good airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We`would stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent end to our honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have been traveling for a month in italy and Paris. So for our last night before we flew home we stayed here. For a one night stay all our expectations were met! We asked to be upgraded to a suite they found us one for 50 extra euro, worth every penny. Room was very large 2 bathrooms, jetted tub, rain shower, huge king bed in a separate room! What more can you ask for on your last night in Europe??!!
reviews.title: Close to CDG airport

reviews.text: The front desk staff was very kind and great to deal with. We went for drinks in the bar and had great service. After 7pm the restaurant has a full menu available and once again we had great service and great food. In fact the best beef tartar I have had in Paris.
reviews.title: Great value at the airport

reviews.text: Ever had that day -when you leave home at 5.am -flight to France business meetings all day then book into your hotel at 18.00hrs to be told NO - you cant book in until 21.30?
reviews.title: "I dont care -attitude"

reviews.text: Well - book with this chain and you will get excatly this, as did other guests that tried to check in. Explaining your circumstances, and that you have a further meeting at 20.00hrs, and you need to rest. wash and change.... I dont care -is the attitude of this Hotel. No matter that I have stayed at this hotel before, and not experienced this issue before. The hotel is only as good as your last visit - and from my last experience, and attitude of the Management, I wont be coming back here.
reviews.title: good room

reviews.text: If you book through the Novotel web site, in English, and your confirmation, is, in English why the hell do the input "special conditions in French" and try to justify what they did to me and other guests? Sorry, but not everybody speaks or reads French, and I booked in English..... so you get the jist - no room - no where to change and wash...but very kindly the Manager on duty allowed me to change and shower in a toilet.....unbelievable.
reviews.title: handy if accomodation needed around Paris / CDG airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since my horrendous experience at this Hotel I was contacted by the General Manager to "offer" his appologies, and not to take this experience as the way the hotel is operated. Well Phillipe - the hotel is only as good as the last visit...and that was MY last visit. For guests looking for hotels in the Roissy area - there are many better priced, more pleasant and accomodating in this area than the Novotel. The have a brand - a good brand - and thats just where they are going wrong. The need to deliver, and for me and other guests trying to check in, they did not deliver.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Basic Rooms, But don't eat here under any circumstances

reviews.text: If you want the luxury of a 4* hotel but not pay the price in the centre of Paris then this hotel is the ideal choice. Located near the CDG airport, there are regular shuttle buses to and from the airport to hotel provided free by the hotel group, Accor. There are 2 pick up points, 1 at Terminal 3 and the other in Terminal 2. Terminal 3 drop off is right outside the station which takes you direct into Paris in 34 minutes. Trains are regular every 15 minutes. The hotel has a lovely spa area which includes a gym, pool and sauna.
reviews.title: Convenient stay near CDG Airport

reviews.text: Had a reasonable stay at the Novotel Roissy. Was there with my family to attend the SIAL exhibition - stayed from 21st to 23rd of Oct. Location, being close to both the airport and the Villipente exhibition grounds, was a plus. The rooms were clean and functional which made our stay quite comfortable.
reviews.title: Reasonable Stay - Quite Functional

reviews.text: The highlight of our stay was the interaction with Ms Katia at the reception. She made us feel very welcome and went out of her way to suggest dining options, make reservations for the same and also for arranging the to & fro transportation. The suggestions made by her - a small Japanese food eatery and a Thai restaurant - both turned out excellent; we really enjoyed both our dinners.
reviews.title: Excellent airport hotel
excellent hotel near airport
reviews.text: On the down side was the service at the hotel restaurant for meals other than breakfast. We had two late afternoon lunches at the hotel on both the occasion the service was pathetic to say the least.

The hotel is quite new and clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We were three adults, so the room was set up with a queen sized bed and a double sofa pull out bed. Well appointed bathroom. Good free shuttle service to Charles de Gaulle terminals. Nice pool and work out areas. Dining room a bit sparse, but decent menu for supper. The village of Roissy is a short walk from the hotel and worth a visit.
reviews.title: Basic Airport Stay

reviews.text: Took the tedious bus shuttle from the CDG airport for an overnight stay. Received no help from the hotel staff carrying 4 luggages checking into the hotel (not their job). The clerk was too busy talking on the phone to be bothered with checking me into the hotel, once I came inside. No help from the staff with the 4 bags to my hotel room. The front desk did not have an electrical conversion plug for my laptop so I could not use the internet service. The hotel room was especially dark and needed more light. Dinner of soup and small piece of salmon in dining room was very expensive, since the Restaurants in the village did not open until 7:00 pm when it was dark. Bathroom was also very small. Breakfast although plentiful was luke warm, staff was nowhere to be found at 5:30 am in the morning. Total damage - $377 USD. Merci Beaucoup for Nothing!
reviews.title: NoGo Novotel and APATHY Spa - STAY AWAY!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After three weeks touring the Loire and living in a Chateau, we had an early morning flight out of Charles de Gaulle Airport and needed somewhere that would be clean, yet not too expensive for a short overnight. I’ve stayed in dumpy and expensive hotels before a transatlantic flight and had no intention of doing that again. The Novotel Convention & Wellness in Roissy was a wonderful surprise. Roissy is a small village adjacent to Charles de Gaulle airport with several hotels to choose from. We were very happy we chose Novotel because it had a lovely spa with steam room and heated pool, plus great gym included in the price. The massages were already booked, so we advise to make a reservation in advance. We definitely needed one after all the walking we had done throughout our trip. We booked a Superior room with double bed (very comfortable Queen) and sofa for E107. There was free wifi (greatly appreciated) and a shower with plenty of hot water. The furnishings are contemporary, modern, and the room was very clean. Everyone was extremely helpful and charming. I speak French fluently but the desk clerks also spoke English.
reviews.title: Wonderful Overnight Hotel at Charles De Gaulle Airport, Paris, France

reviews.text: They offer a complimentary shuttle from/to the airport, which we did take after dropping off our rental car. We waited over an hour. Going to the airport, decided to take a taxi which we were told would be E15, but taxi but cost E25. It was too early in the am to haggle, so we bucked up and paid it although the drive was about 5 minutes.
reviews.title: Close to CDG , makes life easier!!

reviews.text: I definitely recommend this hotel for anyone who has an overnight before an early flight or after a late night flight. Roissy, although charming, is not a town to make your vacation headquarters. There are only a smattering of restaurants and the French countryside is so much more charming. Go to Giverny!
reviews.title: airport hotel paris

aka: Novotel Convention And Wellness Roissy Cdg
description: The Novotel Convention and Wellness Roissy CDG is a 4 star hotel with 289 rooms located near Roissy CDG Airport, 25 km from Paris. Ideal for a business trip to Paris or for seminars and conferences with 1,200 sqm of space across 18 modular rooms. Relax in our Wellness Club, a 600 sqm spa centre with heated swimming pool, Turkish steam bath, sauna, gym, massages and beauty treatments. Contemporary and friendly, our Novotel Cafe will tempt you with its original and varied menu.
